body_html:
Actually the problem occured when I run my own code which is very similar to translate.py + seq2seq_model.py. Im now using ver 0.7.1 . I found that there is no error when i change all of the "/cpu:0" to "/gpu:0" (please refer to below code) from seq2seq_model.py but my own code . with my code when they are not changed, code runs well, but when changed, outputs the error (error above)

if num_samples>0 and num_samples<self.target_vocab_size:
with tf.device("/cpu:0"):
w = tf.get_variable("proj_w", ..........
.......
def sampled_loss(inputs, labels):
with tf.device("/cpu:0"):
...

can you explain what does the error exactly mean?
and I have one more question is that : even it works with those tf.device("/gpu:0"), why there are still using tf.device("/cpu:0") (files in the path tensorflow/python/ops ), any other reason?

Thanks

body:
Actually the problem occured when I run my own code which is very similar to translate.py + seq2seq_model.py. Im now using ver 0.7.1 . I found that there is no error when i change all of the "/cpu:0" to "/gpu:0" (please refer to below code) from seq2seq_model.py but my own code . with my code when they are not changed, code runs well, but when changed, outputs the error (error above)

``` javascript
if num_samples>0 and num_samples<self.target_vocab_size:
with tf.device("/cpu:0"):
w = tf.get_variable("proj_w", ..........
.......
def sampled_loss(inputs, labels):
with tf.device("/cpu:0"):
...

```

can you explain what does the error exactly mean?
and I have one more question is that : even it works with those tf.device("/gpu:0"), why there are still using tf.device("/cpu:0")  (files in the path tensorflow/python/ops ), any other reason?

Thanks
